member.name: T:Ploeh.Albedo.Constructors
member.summary: Provides strongly-typed, refactoring-safe access to instances.

remarks.para: While you can use the standard Reflection API (such as ) to obtain a instance, the problem is that it relies on identifying the constructor by parameter types. This isn't refactoring-safe, so if you change a constructor, your Reflection code may break. Constructors provides a strongly-typed, refactoring-safe alternative, utilizing LINQ expressions.

member.name: M:Ploeh.Albedo.Constructors.Select``1(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0}})
member.summary: Selects a instance based on a strongly-typed, refactoring-safe LINQ expression.
member.typeparam: The type containing the desired constructor.
member.param: A LINQ expression that identifies the desired constructor.
member.returns: A instance representing the constructor identified by .

remarks.para: The Select method provides a strongly-typed, refactoring-safe way to get a instance.

member.example:
This example demonstrates how to use with LINQ method syntax. The Select method returns a instance representing the constructor of .
ConstructorInfo ci = Constructors.Select(() => new string(new char[0]));

member.name: T:Ploeh.Albedo.ReflectionElementEnvy
member.summary: Contains extension methods for dealing with instances, both producing and consuming them.

member.name: M:Ploeh.Albedo.ReflectionElementEnvy.GetProperMethods(System.Type,System.Reflection.BindingFlags)
member.summary: Gets 'proper' methods from the ; that is, methods excluding property accessors, and matching the provided .
member.param: The from which methods are selected
The used to determine which methods to return.
member.returns: The sequence of instances representing the matching methods found on the .

member.name: M:Ploeh.Albedo.ReflectionElementEnvy.GetProperMethods(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets 'proper' methods from the ; that is, methods excluding property accessors. Public | Static | Instance methods are returned.
member.param: The from which methods are selected
member.returns: The sequence of instances representing the public static or public instance methods on the .

member.name: M:Ploeh.Albedo.ReflectionElementEnvy.Accept``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Ploeh.Albedo.IReflectionElement},Ploeh.Albedo.IReflectionVisitor{``0})
member.summary: Accepts the visitor on each of the in the sequence.
member.typeparam: The type of observation or result which the instance produces when visiting nodes.
member.param: The sequence of instances upon which the method will be called.
member.returns: A (potentially) new instance which can be used to continue the visiting process with potentially updated observations.

member.name: M:Ploeh.Albedo.ReflectionElementEnvy.GetPropertiesAndFields(System.Type,System.Reflection.BindingFlags)
member.summary: Gets the matching properties and fields from the , and returns them as a sequence of instances.
member.param: The which properties and fields are obtained from.
The used determine which properties and fields to get.
member.returns: The sequence of instances representing the matching properties and fields from the .

member.name: M:Ploeh.Albedo.ReflectionElementEnvy.GetPublicPropertiesAndFields(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the public instance properties and fields from the , and returns them as a sequence of instances.
member.param: The which properties and fields are obtained from.
member.returns: The sequence of instances representing the public instance properties and fields from the .

member.name: T:Ploeh.Albedo.Refraction.CompositeReflectionElementRefraction`1
member.summary: Composes multiple instances, so that they look like a single instance of IReflectionElementRefraction<T>.
member.typeparam: The type of source objects.

remarks.para: This is a standard implementation of the Composite design pattern.

member.name: T:Ploeh.Albedo.Refraction.IReflectionElementRefraction`1
member.summary: Creates a sequence of instances from a sequence of source objects.
member.typeparam: The type of source objects.

remarks.para: The purpose of the IReflectionElementRefraction<T> interface is to enable clients to easily transform one or more source objects into instances. A common use case is to use implementations of this interface to transform one or more Reflection instances, such as or , into their respective IReflectionElement Adapters. However, because of the existence of , an optional strategy might be to return a NullReflectionElement instance for any source object that doesn't have an appropriate IReflectionElement Adapter.

member.name: M:Ploeh.Albedo.Refraction.IReflectionElementRefraction`1.Refract(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0})
member.summary: Creates a sequence of instances from a sequence of source objects.
member.returns: A sequence of instances created from .

remarks.para: This method doesn't guarantee that the returned sequence has the same number of items as ; in fact, an implementation is allowed to return an empty sequence if no items in the input sequence could be refracted.
Note to implementers:
It's perfectly fine to return an empty sequence if no items in can be refracted. However, is never considered an appropriate return value.
Implementations are allowed to filter the input sequence, or even add new items in the output sequence.

member.name: M:Ploeh.Albedo.Refraction.CompositeReflectionElementRefraction`1.#ctor(Ploeh.Albedo.Refraction.IReflectionElementRefraction{`0}[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.para: After construction, the injected are available by enumerating over the new instance.

member.name: M:Ploeh.Albedo.Refraction.CompositeReflectionElementRefraction`1.Refract(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0})
member.summary: Creates a sequence of instances from a sequence of source objects, but composing the result of invoking Refract on all composed refractions.
member.returns: A a sequence of instances from a sequence of source objects, but composing the result of invoking Refract on all composed refractions.

member.name: M:Ploeh.Albedo.Refraction.CompositeReflectionElementRefraction`1.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the composed refractions.
member.returns: A that can be used to iterate through the composed refractions.

remarks.para: The elements returned by this method are the refractions passed to the constructor when the instance was created.

member.summary: Creates instances from a sequence of source objects.

member.summary: Creates instances from a sequence of source objects.
member.returns: A sequence of instances created from a .

remarks.para: This method creates instances from all matching elements in . An element is matching if it's an instance, in which case a corresponding AssemblyElement is created and returned.

member.name: T:Ploeh.Albedo.Refraction.Conversions
member.summary: Contains conversion methods to turn objects into instances.

member.name: M:Ploeh.Albedo.Refraction.Conversions.AsReflectionElement``1(``0)
member.summary: Converts an object to an instance. This method is guaranteed to always return a proper instance.
member.typeparam: The type of the object to convert.
member.returns: An instance that adapts , if possibly; otherwise, a .

remarks.para: This method is guaranteed to return an instance. However, if can't properly be adapted, a is returned.
For a stricter conversion, you can use .

member.name: M:Ploeh.Albedo.Refraction.Conversions.ToReflectionElement``1(``0)
member.summary: Converts an object to an instance. This method is guaranteed to handle only proper Reflection objects.
member.typeparam: The type of the object to convert.
member.returns: An instance that adapts , if possibly; otherwise, an is thrown.

remarks.para: This method is guaranteed to only convert proper Reflection objects, such as , , , , etc. If isn't such a proper Reflection object, an is thrown.
For a weaker, but more robust conversion, you can use .

member.name: T:Ploeh.Albedo.IReflectionVisitor`1
member.summary: Represents a Visitor which can visit instances.
member.typeparam: The type of observation or calculation the Visitor makes.

remarks.para: Prefer deriving from instead of directly implementing the IReflectionVisitor<T> interface. The reason for this is that future versions of Albedo may add more methods to the interface. This will be a breaking change, so will only happen on major releases, but still, deriving from the ReflectionVisitor<T> base class gives you a better chance that your implementation will be compatible across a major release.

member.summary: Allows an instances to be 'visited'. This method is called when the element 'accepts' this visitor instance.
member.returns: A (potentially) new instance which can be used to continue the visiting process with potentially updated observations.

member.name: T:Ploeh.Albedo.Fields`1
member.summary: Provides strongly-typed, refactoring-safe access to instances.
member.typeparam: The type containing the desired field.

remarks.para: While you can use the standard Reflection API (such as ) to obtain a instance, the problem is that it relies on identifying the field by name, using a string. This isn't refactoring- safe, so if you change the field name, your Reflection code may break. Fields<T> provides a strongly-typed alternative, utilizing LINQ expressions.

member.name: M:Ploeh.Albedo.Fields`1.Select``1(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,``0}})
member.summary: Selects a instance based on a strongly-typed, refactoring-safe LINQ expression.
member.typeparam: The type of the desired field.
member.param: A LINQ expression that identifies the desired field.
member.returns: A instance representing the field identified by .

remarks.para: The Select method provides a strongly-typed, refactoring-safe way to get a instance. It supports both LINQ method syntax, as well as LINQ query syntax.

member.exception: The expression's body isn't a MemberExpression or it doesn't identify a field. The code block supplied should identify a field. Example: x => x.Bar.

member.summary: Provides strongly-typed, refactoring-safe access to instances.

remarks.para: This class provides similar services to , but for static fields.

member.param: A LINQ expression that identifies the desired field.
member.returns: A instance representing the field identified by .
member.exception: The expression's body must be a MemberExpression. The code block supplied should identify a field.\nExample: () => Foo.Bar.;fieldSelector or The expression's body must identify a field, not a property or other member.;fieldSelector

member.name: T:Ploeh.Albedo.Methods`1
member.summary: Provides strongly-typed, refactoring-safe access to instances.
member.typeparam: The type containing the desired method.

remarks.para: While you can use the standard Reflection API (such as ) to obtain a instance, the problem is that it relies on identifying the method by name, using a string. This isn't refactoring-safe, so if you change the method name, your Reflection code may break. Methods<T> provides a strongly-typed alternative, utilizing LINQ expressions.

member.name: M:Ploeh.Albedo.Methods`1.Select(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Action{`0}})
member.summary: Selects a instance based on a strongly-typed, refactoring-safe LINQ expression.
member.param: A LINQ expression that identifies the desired method.
member.returns: A instance representing the method identified by .

remarks.para: The Select method provides a strongly-typed, refactoring-safe way to get a instance. It supports both LINQ method syntax, as well as LINQ query syntax.

member.exception: The expression's body isn't a or it doesn't identify a method. The code block supplied should identify a method. Example: x => x.Foo().

member.name: M:Ploeh.Albedo.Methods`1.Select``1(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,``0}})
member.summary: Selects a instance based on a strongly-typed, refactoring-safe LINQ expression.

remarks.para: The Select method provides a strongly-typed, refactoring-safe way to get a instance. It supports both LINQ method syntax, as well as LINQ query syntax.

member.exception: The expression's body isn't a or it doesn't identify a method. The code block supplied should identify a method. Example: x => x.Foo().

member.name: T:Ploeh.Albedo.Methods
member.summary: Provides strongly-typed, refactoring-safe access to instances.

remarks.para: This class provides similar services to , but for static fields.

member.name: M:Ploeh.Albedo.Methods.Select(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Action})
member.summary: Selects a instance based on a strongly-typed, refactoring-safe LINQ expression.
member.param: A LINQ expression that identifies the desired method.
member.returns: A instance representing the method identified by .

remarks.para: The Select method provides a strongly-typed, refactoring-safe way to get a instance. It supports LINQ method syntax.

member.example:
This example demonstrates how to use with LINQ method syntax. The Select method returns a instance representing the method of .
int dummy = 5; MethodInfo mi = new Methods.Select(() => Math.Abs(dummy));
member.exception: The expression's body isn't a or it doesn't identify a static method. The code block supplied should identify a static method. Example: () => Foo.Bar(). where Bar is static method.

member.name: T:Ploeh.Albedo.ReflectionVisitor`1
member.summary: Represents a Visitor base class which can visit instances.
member.typeparam: The type of observations or calculations the Visitor makes.

remarks.para: Implementers should prefer deriving from this class instead of implementing directly. The reason for this is that future versions of Albedo may add more methods to the interface. This will be a breaking change, so will only happen on major releases, but still, deriving from the ReflectionVisitor<T> base class gives you a better chance that your implementation will be compatible across a major release.
Consumers, on the other hand, should still rely on the IReflectionVisitor<T> interface.

member.name: M:Ploeh.Albedo.ReflectionVisitor`1.Visit(Ploeh.Albedo.AssemblyElement[])
member.summary: Allows an instances to be 'visited'. This method is called when the element 'accepts' this visitor instance.
member.returns: A (potentially) new instance which can be used to continue the visiting process with potentially updated observations.

remarks.para: This implementation relays each instance to , but since the method is virtual, child classes can override it.

member.name: T:Ploeh.Albedo.ValueCollectingVisitor
member.summary: Represents a Visitor which can visit instances, collecting values from or instances.

member.name: M:Ploeh.Albedo.ValueCollectingVisitor.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object[])
member.summary: Constructs a new instance of the which represents the specified .
member.param: The target object instance, from which values will be collected
The existing/initial values from any previous collections

member.name: M:Ploeh.Albedo.ValueCollectingVisitor.Visit(Ploeh.Albedo.AssemblyElement)
member.summary: Visits the specified assembly element.
member.returns: Always throws.
member.exception: Collecting values from an entire assembly is not supported. ValueCollectingVisitor collect values from a single object (the 'target'), and the values collected must correspond to fields or properties on that object. Attempting to collect values from an entire Assembly is meaningless, because an Assembly normally defines more than a single type. In the rare case where you have an assembly with only a single type, use the Visit(TypeElement) overload instead.

member.name: M:Ploeh.Albedo.ValueCollectingVisitor.Visit(Ploeh.Albedo.FieldInfoElement)
member.summary: Visits the and collects the value for this field from the instance.
member.returns: A instance which can be used to continue the visiting process with potentially updated observations.

member.name: M:Ploeh.Albedo.ValueCollectingVisitor.Visit(Ploeh.Albedo.PropertyInfoElement)
member.summary: Visits the and collects the value for this field from the instance.
member.returns: A instance which can be used to continue the visiting process with potentially updated observations.

member.name: P:Ploeh.Albedo.ValueCollectingVisitor.Value
member.summary: Gets the observation or value produced by this instance; the actual values from the visited properties and fields.

member.name: P:Ploeh.Albedo.ValueCollectingVisitor.Target
member.summary: Gets the target object that values are collected from.
